name: Million
long_description: Million is an APM that makes websites fast, automatically. We use AI to automatically find performance issues and write code to fix them.
one_liner: Make websites fast, automatically

name: Glasskube
long_description: Glasskube is building a new packaging ecosystem for Kubernetes. With our Open Source package manager, we aim to replace Helm in the long run and give users a Docker-like experience to build, extend, deploy and distribute Kubernetes applications. We're also working on a cloud-native templating language so anyone building packages for Kubernetes can use a DSL and won't have to use the Go templating engine anymore.
one_liner: The next generation Package Manager for Kubernetes

name: Unsloth AI
long_description:
Unsloth helps builders create custom models better & faster. We're developing the all in one solution to help you create highly-accurate custom models 30x faster with 90% less memory use.

With over 2 million monthly model downloads and 15K GitHub stars, our mission is to make fine-tuning and open-source the best it can be!
one_liner: Open Source Fine-tuning & Training of LLMs

name: Random Labs
long_description: We are building a fully local opensource software engineer. Software thrives on opensource tools and it's only right that this technology be built for all to use.
one_liner: Random labs is building fully open source software agents

name: Stack Auth
long_description:
Stack is an open-source, self-hostable, highly customizable authentication and user management system.

We provide frontend and backend libraries for Next.js, React, and JavaScript. You can set it up in one minute and scale with the project as it grows.

Stack was built by repeat founders with strong technical backgrounds and is funded (among others) by Y Combinator and Guillermo Rauch. Check out our GitHub: https://github.com/stack-auth/stack
one_liner: Open-source auth & user management for developers

name: Gauge
long_description:
Gauge is building open source Python tools that help solve the microservices/monolith dilemma. We’re doing this by enabling teams to build and scale a modular monolith. Our first tool is called Tach, and it lets you create module boundaries automatically. Tach is currently live in production with a number of companies, has over 100k downloads, and over 500 stars on GitHub. Check it out here! https://github.com/gauge-sh/tach

Caelean and Evan first met as roommates in college, and in the decade since they've both worked exclusively at startups, including multiple founding engineering roles. They both ran into this problem time and time again as their startups began to scale.

In the short term, Gauge is building tools to help you scale a modular monolith. Long term, Gauge is building a way to deploy a single codebase as a set of independent services, giving you the scalability of microservices with the simplicity of a monolith.
one_liner: Solving the monolith/microservices dilemma

name: Zenbase AI
long_description:
Zenbase automates prompt engineering and model selection so developers can focus on programming.

We’re core contributors of Stanford NLP’s DSPy, the #1 LLM optimization framework used by Meta, Microsoft, Google, and 40+ others.

We're building the production version.
one_liner: Continuous prompt optimization for LLMs from DSPy core contributors

name: Panora
one_liner: Open source integrations platform for the LLM era

name: Ionworks
long_description: Every battery company spends tens of millions of dollars a year on experiments. Simulations that replace experiments reduce these costs but are currently underutilized in industry because they are hard to create and run. We make simulations accessible to every engineer, by helping them to create models from their own data, then run large scale simulations in the cloud to explore the full design space.
one_liner: Build and run battery simulations at scale

name: Patched
long_description:
Patched is an open-source framework to automate code reviews, docs, and patches with AI.

We empower developers to build and deploy AI-assisted workflows that can autonomously complete repetitive, mundane tasks like documentation, code reviews, and security patching.

Patched is the preferred option for privacy-conscious enterprises and engineer that want to leverage the best AI models for their development workflows without compromising security, control, or compliance.

What makes Patched different?
- Autonomous Automation: Unlike copilots that assist during active development, Patched runs in the background, managing tasks autonomously.
- Code-Native Workflows: Flows can be built using visual editors or Python code.
- Open-Source Flexibility: Allows running patchflows locally and integrating with preferred LLM API endpoints for enhanced privacy.
- Control & Precision: Get full control over your workflows, overcoming limitations of non-deterministic agentic behaviors.
one_liner: Open-source workflow automation for development teams

name: Freestyle
long_description: We are building an abstract cloud for JavaScript engineers. We replace databases, message queues, streaming infrastructure, authorization, and more with open-source JavaScript packages that developers can compose into world-class software. To modularize this capability in JavaScript, we developed a new distributed runtime, hosted by our cloud.
one_liner: Build exceptional infrastructure with just JavaScript.
